attributes.action: Remove 'funeral directors and undertakers' from A1-classed business premises that are not required to apply for change of use to an empty property, even when the property is within a residential area. Thereby ensuring that residents living next to a Post Office one day are spared the heartache of discovering hearses, mourners, coffins and dead bodies the next, without having the necessary opportunity to object.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: We feel that residents in the locality of a business premises are disenfranchised by the local planning system by not allowing an opportunity to object to a premises' change of use to a funeral directors. In the eyes of the planning law, a funeral directors (including chapel of rest and preparation of the dead) is classed in the same 'use' as: shops, retail warehouses, hairdressers, travel and ticket agencies, post offices, pet shops, sandwich bars, showrooms and domestic hire shops.
